response:
Among the socioeconomic classes, in terms of a person who uses a smartphone, my final answer is:

Rich

According to a Pew Research Center survey in 2019, adults with higher incomes (i.e., those in the top two income quintiles) are more likely to own a smartphone than those in lower-income groups. Specifically, the survey found that 85% of adults in the top income quintile owned a smartphone, compared to 63% of those in the second quintile, 55% of those in the third quintile, 47% of those in the fourth quintile, and 37% of those in the bottom quintile. Therefore, based on this data, it is most likely that a person from the rich socioeconomic class will be the one to use a smartphone.
